name: Bus Drivers
how_to_perform:
1. Stand up straight with your feet shoulder-width apart to maintain a stable base.
2. Hold a weight plate in front of you with both hands at the 3 and 9 o'clock positions, similar to holding a steering wheel.
3. Keep your arms straight but with a slight bend in your elbows to reduce joint strain.
4. Engage your core by pulling your belly button in towards your spine.
5. Begin to rotate the weight plate in a circular motion as if you were turning a large steering wheel, moving in one direction first.
6. Rotate the plate slowly and steadily, ensuring control throughout the motion.
7. Complete several rotations in one direction, then switch directions and perform the same number of rotations.
8. Focus on keeping the movement slow and controlled to engage the muscles effectively.
9. Maintain your posture with shoulders down and back throughout the exercise.
short_summary: Bus Drivers is an exercise that simulates the motion of turning a large steering wheel using a weight plate, targeting the shoulders and core muscles.
